result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandie D Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge (if applicable), and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with all Children's Court orders.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served, concurrent to Count 2.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. Court ordered the probation to run concurrent to the probation ordered in Count 2.

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served, concurrent to Count 1.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. Court ordered the probation to run concurrent to the probation ordered in Count 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/13/2015.
-Successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Comply with all Children's Court orders.
-No firearms.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge (if applicable), and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On oral motion of the State, the Court ordered Count 1 amended to two Counts of Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to herplea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.o
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address no contact order. Arguments heard. Court will not modify the no contact over. Case remains scheduled for plea and sentencing on 09/09/2015 at 8:15am. Case adjourned to Branch 38.
Per defense request, case scheduled for Bail/Bond Hearing on 8/18/2015 at 8:15 am.

Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 9-9-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.  
-- Missed Telephone Contact: 6-17-2015.   mld
Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements, received and filed.   mld
Case transferred to Branch 4, due to the assignment of ADA Abbey DeSiato.   mld

Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Desiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Sarah Zwach (under the student practice rule).  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued, including defendant to have no contact with LB, unless supervised by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.   mld
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: LB (dob: 2/2/2003), unless supervised by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandie D Dixon in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant Brandie D Dixon in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
